  • Seminars

Deep Learning

May 19th, 14h-17h

Slides

  • Gabriel Peyré (CNRS and ENS): Parametric Model Fitting with Automatic Differentiation.
  • Alexandre Allauzen (Paris-Sud): Deep-Learning : the basics.
  • Guillaume Charpiat, (INRIA): Part 1 (Which Architectures, for which Purposes), Part 2 (Gradient descents and inner products).

Computational resources

Autodiff and more specific deep-learning softwares (Python):

  • AutoGrad: directly differentiate basic python codes.
  • Chainer: similar purpose.
  • Theano: more advanced (symbolic computation).
  • TensorFlow: similar.
  • PyTorch: similar.
  • Keras: deep learning library (on top of Theano or TensorFlow).
  • Natural gradient in Torch by Gaetan Marceau.

Bibliography

Here is a (biased) bibliography related to the lectures:

  • Deep learning, Ian Goodfellow and Yoshua Bengio and Aaron Courville.
  • Reference article on natural gradient: Riemannian metrics for neural networks I: feedforward networks, Yann Ollivier, Information and Inference.
  • Another article: Practical Riemannian Neural Networks, Gaétan Marceau-Caron and Yann Ollivier.
